ABOUT EXHIBITIONS
A Weave Has a Collaborative Structure, Gallery North, Newcastle Upon Tyne. 2024
Gap Particles, French Riviera, London. 2023
Soflty Swaying. Project at the Swiss Church in London, exploring the themes of community and gift exchange. Digital silk print. More info here. Photos by Peter Otto, 2023
The Algorithmic Pedestal. Images about loss from the Met collection. Exhibition made in collaboration with Oxford Internet Institute and researcher Laura Herman. Digital silk print. More info here. 2023
The Algorithmic Pedestal. Exhibition design in collaboration with Parasite 2.0.
Habitat Series. Images of fragments, printed on silk and unravelled. Installed at muf/architecture art. Exbibition text by Amalia Pica here. Photos by Peter Otto, 2021
Habitat Series, installed at a construction site. Photos by Fabienne Hess, 2021
Habitat Series, installed at Candida Powell-Williams's studio. Photo by Fabienne Hess, 2021
Detail from the Unravelled Series. Billboard installation during Art Night London. Photo by Julien Bader, 2019.
Meadow 672. Images tracing the history of the exhibition site of this work, printed on silk, unravelled, placed on paper, pressed in a frame. Installed at Art Night, photo by Peter Otto, 2019.
Detail from the Unravelled Series. Unravelled work from the Corrupted Series. Photo by Fabienne Hess. 2018
Further Undone Series. Unravelled work from the Corrupted Series. Shown at La Balsa Arte. Photo by Fabienne Hess. 2017
Corrupted Series. Images retrieved via trash-recovery software from my computer. Digitally printed silk. Photos by Fabienne Hess and Like A Little Disaster. 2013. Catalogue entry by Paul Myerscough for Museum Tinguely here.
Collective Vomit. Images found via trash-recovery software on USB sticks belonging to participants of a workshop held at Baltic Centre for Contemporary Art. Shown at Baltic in 2014 and at Dakar Biennal, 2015.
Terms and Conditions. One fifth of Airbnb’s T&C we agree to when using their service. Marker on dust-sheet. Installed here at Upstream Gallery. Photo by Gert Jan van Rooij, 2015.
I Need, Trust Me, Help Me. Appeals found in spam messages. Acrylic/marker on cling film/dust-sheet. Shown at La Balsa Arte, Bogotá. Photos by Fabienne Hess, 2015.
Veintre de Tiburón. Image found on used USB sticks bought in the informal markets of Cali. Digitally printed silk. Shown at Lugar A Dudas, Cali. Photo by Jamie Jenkinson. 2014.
Zebras, Blanks and Blobs. Image families from the University of Edinburgh’s collections. Artist book. Photos by Tenderbooks, 2017.
Zebras, Blanks and Blobs (Windows). Commissioned by the University of Edinburgh, installed at the University of Edinburgh. Photos by Antonia Reeve, 2017.
Hits and Misses (from the archive). One of the University of Edinburgh’s collection entries which at the time of Hits and Misses had never been clicked-on. Installed at Talbot Rice Gallery, photos by Chris Park, 2015.
Hits and Misses (from the archive). The entire digitised collection of the University of Edinburgh. Digitally printed silk. Installed at Talbot Rice Gallery, photos by Chris Park, 2015.
Recovered VII. Images retrieved via trash-recovery software from my computer. Digitally printed silk. Photo by Fabienne Hess, 2012.
